oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-11-14 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 14, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer), guest performers Stonewall Jackson, Jean Shepard, and Don Gibson, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins with Buddy Harman, Minnie Pearl (roughly her 19th anniversary on the Opry), the Jordanaires, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1049th broadcast, the 34th anniversary of the Opry, and that the 8th annual WSM Country Music Disc Jockey Festival is taking place.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; Hank Snow; Don Gibson; Jordanaires; Grandpa Jones
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Hank Snow introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- The Proof Is In The Puffing (Hank Snow) (recording) -- Grant Turner and Hank Snow introduce Don Gibson -- Oh Lonesome Me (Don Gibson, Jordanaires) -- Hank Snow introduces Grandpa Jones -- Eight More Miles To Louisville (Grandpa Jones) -- Grant Turner introduces Hank Snow -- I Don't Hurt Anymore (Hank Snow) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Hank Snow) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial -- Network announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States.
